SummaryEnglish: Rookie office lady Momo-chan and veteran office lady Ume-san are good friends of different generations. Ume-san accepts Momo-chan, who is doing her best in everything, but is slightly out of alignment, with her unfathomable love and tsukkomi. Draw loosely by changing there is work such as complaints and dissatisfaction that unfolds in the office into laughter and love. It is a prescription drama of the heart that is familiar, bright, fun, and light.

1.SummaryEnglish: The first day of work, Ume (Noriko Eguchi) tries to rush to the company cafeteria, but Momo (Sari Ito) asks her to give her two minutes. When she went to the hot water supply room, she heard that the Mount Girls (Megu Aoyama) were talking about the holidays. Momo excitedly reports the details of the mounting battle, and tuts at them. Then, Ume starts talking about her "very unexpected past"...! Sweets des Self-Diagnosis: While Ume is working, Momo, who is wearing a trench coat for some reason, hides in a gap in the desk and speaks to her in a whisper. In fact, Momo was apparently annoyed at being forced to work overtime by her boss (Minagawa Sarutoki) and had gone to buy a large quantity of sweets during her shift. Furthermore, Momo tells Ume that she can self-diagnose what kind of anger she has been building up by deciding which sweets she wants to eat...?

2.TitleEnglish: Perfectionism is a bad idea / Areole fraud
2.SummaryEnglish: Ume (Noriko Eguchi) asks Momo (Sari Ito) to prepare materials for submission to the director (Sarutoki Minagawa), and when she is asked to confirm her progress 15 minutes before the deadline, Momo becomes clumsy... Momo (Sari Ito), who has been asked to prepare a document for submission, is in a daze when she is asked to confirm progress 15 minutes before the deadline... Momo starts to answer the phone in front of Ume and gives an impassioned speech to the caller, who says she will submit the document at the last minute, saying "I know you want to be particular but perfectionism is not good"...! The caller said, "I understand that you want to be particular, but perfectionism is not a good thing..." and then he made an impassioned speech.

3.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito) finds a piece of paper on her desk that reads "Lost maidens, meet in conference room 2 at lunchtime". According to Ume (Noriko Eguchi), it is a kind of workshop for girls, and Ume will also attend. Unsure of what is going on, Momo goes to the meeting room with Ume. Then, her sister (Chiaki Kuriyama), who basically never listens to anyone, dashingly appears. She starts talking one-sidedly about the Valentine's Day chocolate..!

4.SummaryEnglish: When Momo (Sari Ito) spills the beans about "what is it with people who only say the right things", Ume (Noriko Eguchi) replies, "Ah, 'ceylonists'". Ume (Noriko Eguchi) replies, "Ah, 'Ceylonists'". Surprisingly, Ume admires Ceylonists. Momo, unconvinced, lists examples of savoury ceylonists and asks Ume if she still likes them. Gradually, Ume's tone becomes more and more brusque, and the two begin a heated argument!

5.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito) is continuously warned by the head of the department (Sarutoki Minagawa). Ume (Noriko Eguchi) witnesses this and asks, "Do you want to talk about it?" (Ito Sari), who witnesses this, asks, "Shall we talk about it?". Momo then hands Ume a handwritten form, saying, "I'm going to report to the director now. And then she suddenly pulled out a mini keyboard and started singing a song of her own composition, summarising what had happened...?

6.SummaryEnglish: Ume (Eguchi Noriko) encounters Momo (Ito Sari) moping around with her good friend and classmate Yocchan (Sheyashi Riho). Ume learns that Yocchan has a character that doesn't complain, and is worried about her mental state. 'If you eat this kind of food, won't you start to have a crunchy giggle or a petulant complaint?' And he takes out a rusk. Yocchan then tries to complain while eating the rusk...?

7.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito) arrives at work after a long time since the self-restraint period ended, and witnesses the Mount Girls (Megu Aoyama) in the water supply room fighting over how to spend the self-restraint period. She immediately tells Ume (Noriko Eguchi) that "in our company, fighting over mounts has been recognised as an official competitive sport", and reports the match she has just seen. Ume is inadvertently taken in, and the two get into a lively tsukkomi match..!

8.SummaryEnglish: When Ume (Noriko Eguchi) is told by Momo (Sari Ito), "Lately, I often get told off for speaking from the conclusion," Ume (Noriko Eguchi) replies, "I still think you should speak from the conclusion." Ume (Noriko Eguchi) replied, "I still think it's better to speak from the conclusion. The unusually tense atmosphere unexpectedly gets the two of them excited, and they use the tension as a topic to get into a lively conversation. Momo then asks, "Is it so important to talk about the conclusion?" Momo raises the question: "Is it so important to talk about the conclusion? She develops a philosophical theory...?

9.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito) asked Ume (Noriko Eguchi) if there was a good graft clinic near the office. During lunch, her classmates, who were nodding their heads and listening to their seniors, increased their nodding speed and eventually went into a headbanging state, so she thought, "I have to help them as soon as possible!" they thought. Momo's passionate thoughts ran wild, as she was not worried about the cervical vertebrae of her seniors' caring peers. She became intensely delusional...

10.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito) asked Ume (Noriko Eguchi), "I feel embarrassed when I use the end of the word 'fortunately' in e-mails and such, but isn't it like that?" (Do you ever feel embarrassed when you use the end of a word like 'Fortunately' in e-mails? She said she felt uncomfortable with the "correct business keigo", which she does not normally use. However, Ume did not sympathise with her at all. So Momo teases him with all the business keigo she can think of..!

11.SummaryEnglish: When Momo (Sari Ito) asks, "How did you do the printing on one page?" Ume (Noriko Eguchi) asked, "Do you know what they say about people who don't look things up and just ask other people?" Ume (Noriko Eguchi) replies with a question. But... for some reason, Momo replies in an amusing way, as if she were a "good woman", and Ume forgets her anger and laughs at her! ...?

12.SummaryEnglish: While the employees around her have their eyes bawling with confirmed overtime, Momo (Sari Ito) throws her work away and proudly announces to Ume (Noriko Eguchi) when she reaches her regular hours that she is going home. When Ume tries to stop her, Momo says, "The reason we work so much overtime is because the company hasn't made progress with IT. Our company is on the losing side of the IT gap", and emphasises that going home on time is a "silent protest against the company". Ume-san is not dissatisfied?" He then asks, "Are you not satisfied?

13.SummaryEnglish: About two years ago - Ume (Noriko Eguchi) and Ringo (Asako Ito), who works in the president's office, find new employee Momo (Sari Ito) crying by herself. Ume asks Momo, who says she "stumbled on her first day at the company", what happened. Momo confesses that she has been bluffing and bluffing since her first day at the company, but it hasn't worked out. Ume and Ringo can't stop laughing when they hear about all the bluffs she has put up so far...

14.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito), Ume (Noriko Eguchi) and Ringo (Asako Ito) hit it off and go to their second pub. Momo (Sari Ito), who has completely let her guard down, becomes very talkative and starts to aggressively attack the two senpai (senior students). She also puts herself on the back burner and says, "I don't like people who come on to me when I first meet them. Ume and Ringo are amused and take the role of listeners, and start complaining about the fact that they have been "allowed" to call her by her nickname by a colleague they have never met before...

15.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito) is brooding as the bonus payment date approaches. Ume (Noriko Eguchi) says: "I've never seen an office worker who is excited about her bonus and uses it in a good way. It's all gone." Momo then says that she too is like that. Momo then says that she has been in such a situation herself, and she recounts her experience, saying, "The scary thing is when you don't remember what you spent it on". Momo asks Ume how she spent her bonus...?

16.SummaryEnglish: One day in the middle of the rainy season, Momo (Sari Ito) arrives at work with a clenched face. After reading a special feature on strong women in a magazine, Momo decides to stop lamenting about the hardships of the rainy season and tries hard to suppress her complaints about the harmful effects of the low pressure. Ume (Noriko Eguchi), seeing this, suggested that Momo should train herself to change her words into positive ones, instead of suppressing her emotions. Momo immediately puts this into practice...?

17.TitleEnglish: Shihan-dai in a clash with a teacher
17.SummaryEnglish: When Momo (Sari Ito) says she no longer knows how to write a report, Ume (Noriko Eguchi) says, "Why don't you just write it normally?" Ume (Noriko Eguchi) advises, "Why don't you just write it in a normal way? Then Momo suddenly started screaming and shaking. When Ume asks what happened, she learns that every time Momo submits something, Nakayama of the General Affairs Section calls her "normally". Momo is frightened, saying, "That's just like a teacher in a clash. She is frightened, and begins to fantasise about what might happen if she doesn't...

18.SummaryEnglish: Ume (Noriko Eguchi) is busy working when Momo (Sari Ito) asks her, "Can I ask you a quick giggle question?" She asked. Ume cautions her that "how to talk to busy seniors is actually a pretty important business skill, so you should learn it a bit better" and teaches her a specific way to talk to them. However, no matter how many times she tries again, Momo always ends up talking to him in an off-the-wall way...

19.SummaryEnglish: Momo (Sari Ito) is working overtime to rave reviews next to Ume (Noriko Eguchi) as she prepares to leave. Her boss asks her to prepare a document by next week, and when she tries to make herself comfortable, she is suddenly told she has until tomorrow morning to do it. Momo is upset and says, "A boss who repeatedly does that is called a 'chorebokkuri'. She says she has been taking care of herself in a "certain way" so that she doesn't become one of them..!

20.TitleEnglish: A gift from our forefathers to the future
20.SummaryEnglish: We work too hard, don't we? Not so much us, but us human beings", Momo (Sari Ito) asks a grand question. Ume (Noriko Eguchi) is a little surprised. Momo then sniffs, "I think humans have developed various things to make life easier", she continues. Ume calmly replies, "Shouldn't we be grateful?" Momo was disappointed by this reaction. She then snorted even harder and developed her own theory..!
